document.topic_text: Close Fire sparks at American Greetings' Ohio headquarters April 25, 2016: Patrice Sadd, Director of Communications for American Greetings, discusses a fire that hit the company's headquarters. Ryan Haidet , WKYC 10:36 AM. EST April 25, 2016 Viewer-submitted photo. BROOKLYN, Ohio -- Crews have extinguished a fire that broke out at the American Greetings world headquarters building in Brooklyn early Monday. WKYC received an e-mail from a viewer shortly after 9 a.m. saying employees had been evacuated. Officials say the flames began around 8:40 a.m., and were contained to a kitchen area. Nobody was hurt. Patrice Sadd, Director of Communications for American Greetings, said the company has allowed associates to leave and work from home. "There is a portion of the building that we are not allowed in right now," Sadd said. The extent of the damage is unknown, and the cause of the fire remains under investigation. There are approximately 1,700 employees who work in the building. "Business will resume as normal tomorrow," Sadd said.
